reviewText: I should lay my cards on the table...We all have "favourite" films and film stars, and sometimes there is no real logical explanation why. It's just personal. I say this because "Noose..." and Jim Davis are in that category for me. "Noose.." produced by Robt E. Kent and directed by the prolific E.L. Cahn, is here on MGM Limited Edition Collection and once again they have not let me down. Excellent B/W photography and clear sound and 1.66 Wide Screen help a pretty standard Western plot along, (done also in Top Gun and Quick Gun). Jim is Case Britton (what a name!) returning to the town he left several years ago after killing Barton MacLane's sons in a gunfight. Barton and his bully boys (Leo Gordon-excellent-and John hart-unbilled) are not pleased. Jim is actually there to meet his bride to be and warn the town that the dirty smelly Ted De Corsia and his gang (William Tannen and Bill Challee etc) are on the way....It's good professional standard stuff all the way through and not a moment is wasted. So, bearing in mind my opening comments, I give this 5 stars and highly recomend it for western and Jim Davis fans.
summary: "Nothing Ever Held You As Taut As...."

reviewText: Just an average western for its era really.  Acting is quite a good standard, but the story has a few weak points at times.  Good enough viewing for a genuine western fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another excellent classic western, a yesteryear chock full of ethical and moral values as tasty as a stack of blueberry pancakes dripping with butter and real maple syrup. Good guys, bad guys, bank robbers, crooked politicians, corrupt sheriff, the girl (a great parallel to the gorgeous young Grace Kelly in High Noon here) the romance, the ultimatums and tension, the good 'n plenty ending, this one has it all. Much better than the value-vacant drivel they make for kids today. Love it for the whole family.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was a GREAT old fashion western...SHAME ON AMAZON for the deceitful way they try to entice viewers to watch it by omitting information about the film. It was a very good, very predictable ole fashion good guy verse bad guy western. There are still some of us that enjoy a ole fashion shoot'em up Saturday/ Sunday afternoon western.

reviewText: I think this is pretty good for an old western. Simple as expected plot, but still very entertaining. Worth a watch!
